ingredients: 8 ounces brie cheese, cut into small pieces
instructions: Roll out the thawed puff pastry on a lightly floured surface and cut it into 3-inch squares.
Place a piece of brie cheese in the center of each pastry square and top with a spoonful of cranberry sauce.
Fold the corners of the pastry over the filling to create a pocket and seal with a fork.
Brush the tops with the beaten egg for a golden finish.
Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes or until golden brown and puffed.
tips: To achieve the perfect baked cranberry brie bites, ensure your puff pastry is cold before working with it to maintain its flakiness. Use high-quality brie for a creamy texture and rich flavor. Avoid overfilling the pastry to prevent leaks during baking. These bites can be made ahead of time; simply assemble and freeze them before baking.
